name: 'The Indians In The Lobby' Online Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where did the boy that Josh was trying to get extradited back to Georgia go to escape prosecution?
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	The thirteen year old boy's parents sent him to Italy after he killed his teacher because Italy won't extradite to countries that have the death penalty. In order to get the boy extradited back to Georgia, Josh made a deal with the prosecuting attorney not to seek the death penalty and he'll have all the financial backing he wants for his re-election campaign. The prosecuting attorney agreed.

questions.text: What tribe were the Indians from that were in the lobby of the White House?
questions.explanation:
Munsee.

	Josh told CJ there were Indians in the lobby so she had to deal with them even though she was done for the day. Maggie Morningstar-Charles and Jack Lone Feather were at the White House to talk to someone about buying back land that was stolen from them fifteen years ago. Because it was the Thanksgiving holiday, CJ worked it out for them to stay over and see someone from the Interior Department after the holiday.

questions.text: According to the President, which first lady didn't like Camp David?
questions.explanation:
Bess Truman.

	The President got a hold of a poll that said people wanted him to have Thanksgiving at Camp David. The President said Bess Truman didn't like Camp David because "she thought it was dull."

questions.text: Who asked the President if they were crossing the line?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	The President was discussing spices with CJ. When CJ told him she blacked out during the conversation and asked if she was coming upon the point of crossing the line, the President said, "No, no, look behind you."

questions.text: Who forgot where his mother lived?
questions.explanation:
Josh.

	Donna had to make plane reservations for Josh at the last minute because he forgot that his mother moved from Connecticut to Florida. She told him she was going to tell his mother that he forgot where she lived.

questions.text: Josh said he used to make fun of people like Donna when he was in elementary school.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Donna told him she knew he used to make fun of people like her.

questions.text: What did Sam say when Josh told him there were Indians in the lobby?
questions.explanation:
"Is that code for something?".

	Josh told Sam not to go into the lobby because there were Indians in it. Sam thought it was a code for something.

questions.text: When he was talking to the Butterball Hotline, where did the President say he was from?
questions.explanation:
North Dakota.

	Toby wouldn't let him give his real name so the President said he was Joe Bethersinton from Apartment 23 11454 Pruder Street, Fargo, North Dakota. When the woman recognized his voice, he told her that he did radio commercials for products.

questions.text: According to Abbey, how many languages does the President speak?
questions.explanation:
4 & four.

	When the President found out that Abbey set it up for them to have Thanksgiving at Camp David, the President spoke what sounded like French to her. After he was done, she said, "You speak four languages. Why can't one of them be French?"

questions.text: During this episode, who made several references to fish?
questions.explanation:
Bruno.

	Bruno Gianelli told the President a story about when he went fishing and then he told Toby about Barnum and Bailey selling fish to make money.
